thread.title: Petron, Foton clash today
thread.title_full: Petron, Foton clash today | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Kristel Satumbaga
title: Petron, Foton clash today
text:
by Kristel Satumbaga
October 15, 2015 Games Today
(The Arena, San Juan)
4:15 p.m. – Meralco vs RC Cola
6:15 p.m. – Petron vs Foton
After a shock opening day defeat, defending champion Petron goes for its first back-to-back win when it battles dangerous Foton today in the Philippine Superliga (PSL) Grand Prix at The Arena in San Juan.
The Blaze Spikers are expecting a marathon match with the Tornadoes in their 6:15 p.m. clash since the latter will be unveiling a new weapon in National University star Jaja Santiago.
The 6-foot-4 Santiago missed the team’s opening game due to school commitments but her absence hardly mattered as imports Lindsay Stalzer and Katie Messing stepped up and helped Foton stun Meralco, 25-23, 25-22, 25-16.
Stalzer, standing at 6-foot-2, fired 18 points to kick off Foton’s title campaign on a high note.
This marks the first time that Santiago will be playing against older sister Dindin Santiago-Manabat who leads a star-studded Petron squad.
Aside from Manabat, also expected to deliver for the Blaze Spikers are Rachel Anne Daquis and Aby Maraño, as well as Brazilian imports Rupia Inck and setter Erica Adachi.
A Foton victory would enable the Tornadoes to tie the Cignal HD Spikers for the lead.
Cignal stayed unbeaten in two games by pulling off a15-25, 25-15, 25-17, 19-25, 16-14 victory over Philips Gold on Tuesday.
Import Ariel Usher sizzled anew for the Blaze Spikers with 30 points, including 27 attacks, even as fellow guest player Amanda Anderson chipped in 18 points.
RC Cola-Air Force, meanwhile, starts its title campaign against the still winless Meralco at 4:15 p.m.
Petron bounced back from a stinging defeat to Cignal with a straight-set win over Meralco on Tuesday.
“We’re starting to regain our composure,” said Petron Coach George Pascua. “Losing to Cignal is a wake-up call for us. We just have to be ready all the time.”
